content.user_title: Enforce backend coding standards and atomic commits
content.value_statement: Backend code often fails quality gates and contains non-atomic commits that hurt team productivity. This skill runs Ruff, ty, Django checks, and security scripts to fix code issues and enforce commit standards without adding AI signatures to commit messages.
actual_capabilities: Run Ruff formatting and linting fixes on changed Python files
Execute type checking with ty on modified files only
Run Django system checks and targeted pytest subsets
Enforce local AGENTS.md and CLAUDE.md rules
Detect and fix local imports, type hints, and logging patterns
Generate ticket-prefixed commit messages without AI signatures
limitations: Requires Django project structure with manage.py and .security scripts
Cannot run without uv or local tool wrappers (.bin/ruff, .bin/ty)
Does not modify migration files or schema changes automatically

use_cases.title: Auto-fix code before commit
use_cases.description: Run pre-commit mode to automatically fix formatting, imports, type hints, and logging patterns in staged files

use_cases.title: Enforce commit atomicity
use_cases.description: Verify staged changes represent one logical change and all quality gates pass before allowing commit

use_cases.title: Standardize backend tooling
use_cases.description: Apply consistent Ruff, ty, and Django checks across all backend contributions with clear blocking issues

prompt_templates.title: Fix pre-commit issues
prompt_templates.prompt: Run /backend-atomic-commit:pre-commit on this repo and fix all files in git status to obey AGENTS.md, pre-commit-config.yaml, and security scripts

prompt_templates.title: Prepare atomic commit
prompt_templates.prompt: Use /backend-atomic-commit:atomic-commit to prepare an atomic commit for staged changes in backend/

prompt_templates.title: Strict mode fix
prompt_templates.prompt: Run /backend-atomic-commit:pre-commit in strict mode: eliminate local imports, fix type hints, clean debug statements

prompt_templates.title: Verify commit readiness
prompt_templates.prompt: Run /backend-atomic-commit:atomic-commit --auto to enforce structured logging, verify tests, and report commit readiness

output: Fixes applied: Fixed 3 local imports in optimo_events.py, Added type hints to 2 functions, Reformatted logging to structured style
Checks run: Ruff (pass), ty (pass), Django check (pass), security/ruff_pr_diff.sh (pass)
Remaining issues: [SHOULD_FIX] Missing docstring in survey_helper.py, [NIT] Variable name 'data' in line 42

best_practices: Run pre-commit mode before staging files to catch issues early and avoid CI failures
Always address [BLOCKING] items before attempting atomic commits
Use the scoped ty check to catch type errors without triggering baseline errors in unmodified files
anti_patterns: Running atomic-commit mode without reviewing proposed commit message first
Ignoring [SHOULD_FIX] items that accumulate over multiple commits
Using local imports to avoid cyclic import problems instead of refactoring code structure

faq.question: What tools does this skill require?
faq.answer: Requires uv, Ruff, ty (type checker), and Django management. Looks for .bin/ wrappers first with uv run fallback.

faq.question: Does this work with non-Django Python projects?
faq.answer: Falls back to generic Python pre-commit behavior if no manage.py or Django-style AGENTS.md is detected.

faq.question: How does it handle pre-existing code issues?
faq.answer: Resolves ALL issues in files you modify, not just new ones. CI runs checks on modified files only.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Runs locally on your machine using only local tools. No data is sent anywhere. Git operations stay in your repo.

faq.question: Why are my commits showing AI signatures?
faq.answer: This skill explicitly prevents AI signatures. Check your AI tool settings or other plugins that may add signatures.

faq.question: How is this different from pre-commit hooks?
faq.answer: Runs the same checks as your hooks but also auto-fixes issues and enforces atomic commit structure before you commit.
